thread.title_full: Fed Cup: German NAZI national anthem gaffe sung at Andrea Petkovic and Alison Riske match | World | News | Express.co.uk

author: Allan Hall
title: Fed Cup: German NAZI national anthem gaffe sung at Andrea Petkovic and Alison Riske match | World | News | Express.co.uk
text:
EPA Alison Riske of the United States 
It was sung before the match between German Andrea Petkovic and Alison Riske of the United States . I've never felt more disrespected in my whole life Andrea Petkovic 
Petkovic, who was born in Bosnia, said in the German-speaking portion of her press conference that she considered walking off the court as the anthem went on. 
"I thought it was the epitome of ignorance, and I've never felt more disrespected in my whole life, let alone in Fed Cup, and I've played Fed Cup for 13 years now and it is the worst thing that has ever happened to me," Petkovic said after losing the match. 
The United States Tennis Association quickly apologised, saying: "The USTA extends its sincerest apologies to the German Fed Cup team and all of its fans for the performance of an outdated national anthem prior to today's Fed Cup competition. EPA World's hottest tennis stars Mon, June 27, 2016 Anyone for tennis? As play begins at Wimbledon, here's a look at the world's hottest tennis players who have graced the courts at Wimbledon
